channel.title: Behance Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance

item.title: Beauty & Beast II
item.description: Guim Tió is a young artist from Barcelona. His research interest in pictorial part of the human condition, treated with humor, irony and a strong degree of provocation, and reflects on a society full of taboos and subjected to a very visual tyranny of television, advertising and, of course, of fashion magazines. With the model representations and contemporary references in behavior and appearance, beauty and glamor, extracted from the coated paper for magazines, Guim makes a pictorial oper?a(c)tion? through brilliantly combined with the photographic medium - to "eye surgery": a metaphor for the physical manipulation of plastic surgery, genetics and cybernetics, revealing that dark part of the human soul hided behind the pretense of perfection. The artist stages a controversial issue for contemporary society and his work becomes an exploration of the collective unconscious, which governs the aesthetic valences on all types of human monstrosities in the sign of narcissistic beauty emulation as the key to success; a parody of stereotypes that today govern the new conceptions of the meaning "human being". Original text from Massimo Cova.
item.content:encoded: Guim Tió is a young artist from Barcelona. His research interest in pictorial part of the human condition, treated with humor, irony and a strong degree of provocation, and reflects on a society full of taboos and subjected to a very visual tyranny of television, advertising and, of course, of fashion magazines. With the model representations and contemporary references in behavior and appearance, beauty and glamor, extracted from the coated paper for magazines, Guim makes a pictorial oper?a(c)tion? through brilliantly combined with the photographic medium - to "eye surgery": a metaphor for the physical manipulation of plastic surgery, genetics and cybernetics, revealing that dark part of the human soul hided behind the pretense of perfection. The artist stages a controversial issue for contemporary society and his work becomes an exploration of the collective unconscious, which governs the aesthetic valences on all types of human monstrosities in the sign of narcissistic beauty emulation as the key to success; a parody of stereotypes that today govern the new conceptions of the meaning "human being". Original text from Massimo Cova.

item.title: DESIGN DAYS 2012
item.description: This poster presents a typographic composition mixed with a chair that embodies design furniture. The text, placed in a tabulated and impacting fashion, offers a great visibility to the picture. The different elements of the poster are complimenting each other to harmonize and give dynamic to the layout. For instance the chair follows the angle of the letter «Y» to draw a diagonal that stimulates the composition. The poster was silk-screen printed in 3 colours
item.content:encoded: This poster presents a typographic composition mixed with a chair that embodies design furniture. The text, placed in a tabulated and impacting fashion, offers a great visibility to the picture. The different elements of the poster are complimenting each other to harmonize and give dynamic to the layout. For instance the chair follows the angle of the letter «Y» to draw a diagonal that stimulates the composition. The poster was silk-screen printed in 3 colours

item.title: Square UI - Awesome Flat User Interface Pack
item.description: Square UI is our latest PSD User Interface Pack including a set of beautiful and pure components, which you can use to create startup projects, websites or iOS/Android Apps. We love the latest flat design trend, and Square UI is made exactly in that style. The simple, colorful and flat-designed components of Square UI are perfect for almost any project, from complex web applications and small startup projects to websites.
item.content:encoded: Square UI is our latest PSD User Interface Pack including a set of beautiful and pure components, which you can use to create startup projects, websites or iOS/Android Apps. We love the latest flat design trend, and Square UI is made exactly in that style. The simple, colorful and flat-designed components of Square UI are perfect for almost any project, from complex web applications and small startup projects to websites.

item.title: Giahi
item.description: Giahi is a series of specialized tattoo and piercing studios located in Zurich, Switzerland. The custom type designed for the logo is riddled with detail and conveys the artful and precise process of tattoo-making. The tiny, sharp peaks and crevices found in the type directly associates with the moment and accuracy of the tattooing needle piercing human skin. There is a gold-stamped droplet in the closed counter of the logo's letter 'A', a tribute to the everlasting effect of ink in human skin. The golden cross symbol at the bottom of the logotype is a salute to the brand's Swiss nationality. The logo-type layout and weight is heavily influenced by the art and insignia on the leather jackets of American biker gangs of the 1960's. While the weight of the logo's typography conveys the toughness and coarseness associated with tattoos, the minute and elaborate markings and details speak of the precision and craftsmanship typical of Switzerland and its devoted clock makers.
item.content:encoded: Giahi is a series of specialized tattoo and piercing studios located in Zurich, Switzerland. The custom type designed for the logo is riddled with detail and conveys the artful and precise process of tattoo-making. The tiny, sharp peaks and crevices found in the type directly associates with the moment and accuracy of the tattooing needle piercing human skin. There is a gold-stamped droplet in the closed counter of the logo's letter 'A', a tribute to the everlasting effect of ink in human skin. The golden cross symbol at the bottom of the logotype is a salute to the brand's Swiss nationality. The logo-type layout and weight is heavily influenced by the art and insignia on the leather jackets of American biker gangs of the 1960's. While the weight of the logo's typography conveys the toughness and coarseness associated with tattoos, the minute and elaborate markings and details speak of the precision and craftsmanship typical of Switzerland and its devoted clock makers.

item.title: Adobe - Myths
item.description: I was commissioned to create a series of typographic illustrations and corresponding '&'s for a campaign promoting Adobe's social, marketing, and analytics software. The illustrations dramatise popular myths and perceptions related to those fields. ?The treatments were used in a variety of digital and printed executions. Several of the executions were also translated into German and French for use in Europe Agency: Goodby, Silverstein & Partners Creative Director: Jim King
item.content:encoded: I was commissioned to create a series of typographic illustrations and corresponding '&'s for a campaign promoting Adobe's social, marketing, and analytics software. item.title: Flight Tag Prints
item.description: Flight Tag Prints Recently I stumbled on a lovely set of old airline baggage tags and was amazed at the variety in designs produced since the 1950s. There was something about the now iconic, easily reconisable three letter abbreviations of the city destinations, and the small surrounding details that I thought would look great blown up and on a wall. They often avoided logos, had no advertising, and were purely just the information you needed. So with these graphic and typographic gems I decided to go ahead and turn them into large format wall prints. As with other ideas for prints that I have had, if they prove popular i'll make them available in my online shop this Spring. Enjoy!
item.content:encoded: Flight Tag Prints Recently I stumbled on a lovely set of old airline baggage tags and was amazed at the variety in designs produced since the 1950s. There was something about the now iconic, easily reconisable three letter abbreviations of the city destinations, and the small surrounding details that I thought would look great blown up and on a wall. They often avoided logos, had no advertising, and were purely just the information you needed. So with these graphic and typographic gems I decided to go ahead and turn them into large format wall prints. As with other ideas for prints that I have had, if they prove popular i'll make them available in my online shop this Spring. Enjoy!

item.title: Rise of the Guardians: YouTube Experience
item.description: For DreamWorks Animation's Rise of the Guardians we build a custom YouTube takeover and YouTube channel to let users explore the extensive world of the Guardians through trailers, clips, drawing tutorials, behind-the-scenes footage and more. And to attract more people to this YouTube channel we also made a custom animated video featuring Jack Frost in a snowball fight.
item.content:encoded: For DreamWorks Animation's Rise of the Guardians we build a custom YouTube takeover and YouTube channel to let users explore the extensive world of the Guardians through trailers, clips, drawing tutorials, behind-the-scenes footage and more. And to attract more people to this YouTube channel we also made a custom animated video featuring Jack Frost in a snowball fight.

item.title: OPERATION SMILE | CALENDAR
item.description: ART DIRECTOR | Natalie Vella COPY WRITER | Melanie Horenz ILLUSTRATOR | Shy the Sun TYPOGRAPHER | Ben Johnston AWARDS | Gold Craft Loerie Award Operation Smile, is a non-profit organisation that provides free surgeries to repair cleft lips and palates in Southern Africa. In order to raise funds for these operations we developed an interactive birthday calendar demonstrating just how easy it is to fix a child?s smile. The calendar arrives full of broken smiles. All you have to do to use the calendar is to fix the child?s smile by flipping through the pages until the two halves match. It?s that easy. Thanks to over a ? of a million rand generated from calendar sales, our client can continue fixing thousands of children?s smiles, changing their lives forever.
item.content:encoded: ART DIRECTOR | Natalie Vella COPY WRITER | Melanie Horenz ILLUSTRATOR | Shy the Sun TYPOGRAPHER | Ben Johnston AWARDS | Gold Craft Loerie Award Operation Smile, is a non-profit organisation that provides free surgeries to repair cleft lips and palates in Southern Africa. In order to raise funds for these operations we developed an interactive birthday calendar demonstrating just how easy it is to fix a child?s smile. The calendar arrives full of broken smiles. All you have to do to use the calendar is to fix the child?s smile by flipping through the pages until the two halves match. It?s that easy. Thanks to over a ? of a million rand generated from calendar sales, our client can continue fixing thousands of children?s smiles, changing their lives forever.

item.title: BVLGARI Pavilion at Abu Dhabi Art 2012
item.description: The 2012 Bulgari Pavilion and b.lounge at Abu Dhabi Art 2012 by Not a Number Architects (NaNA). Commissioned by Bulgari as part of a VIP lounge for the Abu Dhabi Art at Manarat al Saadiyat Nov 2012 A completely self supporting structure built from 2272 Acrylic tubes and joined with 10,000 polycarbonate connectors. Bespoke lighting system by Artisan (United Visual Artists)
item.content:encoded: The 2012 Bulgari Pavilion and b.lounge at Abu Dhabi Art 2012 by Not a Number Architects (NaNA). Commissioned by Bulgari as part of a VIP lounge for the Abu Dhabi Art at Manarat al Saadiyat Nov 2012 A completely self supporting structure built from 2272 Acrylic tubes and joined with 10,000 polycarbonate connectors. Bespoke lighting system by Artisan (United Visual Artists)
